column1: BOSTON ( AP ) -- Aubrey Huff learned from his past struggles against Hideki Okajima . He knew he had to be patient against Boston 's reliever . 	 He waited long enough Tuesday night to attack a pitch that was higher than Okajima wanted and hit a tying two - run single
column2: one of his four hits in the Baltimore Orioles 10 - 6 win over the Red Sox . 	 " He threw a couple of heaters that I could n't get to that were pretty well placed today
column4: who was 1 - for-7 with three strikeouts against Okajima before the game . " He left me a changeup up a little bit . Other than that
column5: we 've been patient against him . " 	 The Orioles have eight of the nine runs Okajima has allowed this year . They added three more in the ninth against Craig Hansen while their own bullpen pitched four scoreless innings . 	 " After you score
column6: you have to put a zero up and that turns it around
column7: " Baltimore manager Dave Trembley said . " You 've got to wait [ Okajima ] out . You ca n't chase pitches off the plate . " 	 Baltimore rebounded from deficits of 1 - 0 and 6 - 4 and overcame homers by Manny Ramirez and J.D. Drew as the Red Sox lost for only the second time in their last 17 games at Fenway Park . 	 On a steamy night with a game - time temperature of 93 degrees
column8: the Orioles scored in just three innings with four runs in the second
column9: three in the seventh and three in the ninth . They 've scored 29 runs in their last four games
column10: three of them wins . 	 " It 's tough to come in here and play . It always has been ever since I 've been in this division
column12: who spent 6½ seasons with Tampa Bay . " Probably the best thing we did was tack on three more runs there in the ninth inning because I 've seen these guys come back . " 	 After Huff 's tying single
column13: Kevin Millar hit a sacrifice fly off Manny Delcarmen for a 7 - 6 lead . 	 Okajima has allowed eight earned runs in 5 1/3 innings against Baltimore
column14: an ERA of 13.50 this year . In his other games
column15: he 's given up just one run in 22 2/3 innings
column16: an ERA of 0.40 . 	 " He was up with a lot of pitches and behind in the count
column17: " Boston manager Terry Francona said . 	 The Orioles padded the lead in the ninth against Hansen
column18: loading the bases with no outs on a single by Nick Markakis
column19: an error by second basemen Dustin Pedroia and Huff 's fourth single . Jay Payton 's infield single drove in one run and Ramon Hernandez 's single sent home the last two . 	 George Sherrill pitched the ninth but did not add to his total of 21 saves
column20: third in the majors . After Daniel Cabrera allowed six runs in five innings
column23: Chad Bradford and Sherrill held the Red Sox scoreless . 	 Boston rallied to take a 6 - 4 lead in the fifth on a two - run homer by Drew
column25: after Pedroia was hit by Cabrera 's pitch . Ramirez then hit his 15th homer of the season and 505th of his career
column26: snapping a tie with former Oriole Eddie Murray and going into 23rd place on the career list . 	 In a pregame ceremony
column27: Murray presented Ramirez with a plaque commemorating his 500th homer
column28: hit off Bradford in Baltimore on May 31 . But with two outs and the bases empty in the seventh
column29: Bradford retired Ramirez on a popup to first baseman Millar . 	 Bradford also reached a No . 500 milestone -- his number of major league appearances . 	 " He got his 500th against me
column30: " Bradford said . " It 's a little bit different deal . It was just good that we were able to pull out the win . " 	 Josh Beckett had just one bad inning when he gave up four runs in the second on two - run doubles by Freddie Bynum and Brian Roberts that gave Baltimore a 4 - 3 lead . 	 " I did n't think he hit it hard
column31: " Beckett said of Roberts ' hit off the left field wall . " I think at first he thought it was an out
column32: then he thought that there was a chance just with the way wind was swirling that it was going to hit the wall . " 	 The Red Sox had taken a 1 - 0 lead in the first when Jacoby Ellsbury singled
column33: took third on Pedroia 's double and scored when Ramirez grounded into a double play . 	 They cut the lead to 4 - 3 in the third when they loaded the bases with no outs on a single by Pedroia
column34: a walk to Drew and a single by Ramirez . Pedroia scored when Mike Lowell grounded into a forceout at second and Drew came in on another force play . 	 Game notes 	 Ramirez extended his hitting streak to 14 games and Drew to nine . ... Pedroia broke an 0 - for-18 slump . ... Baltimore designated RHP Steve Trachsel for assignment and promoted 1B Oscar Salazar from Triple - A Norfolk . Trachsel was 2 - 5 with an 8.39 ERA in 10 games . ... The Orioles wore black armbands in memory of sportscaster Jim McKay
column35: a minority owner of the team who died Saturday . ... The Red Sox hit consecutive homers for the sixth time this season . ... Boston just missed two homers in the third when Ramirez 's shot to right and Lowell 's drive to left just went foul . ... Ramirez tied Tony Perez for 24th on the all - time list with 1
column36: 652 RBIs . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column1: CLEVELAND ( AP ) -- C.C. Sabathia took the mound almost certain he needed to pitch a shutout . So he did . 	 Sabathia ( 4 - 8) pitched a five - hitter for his seventh career shutout as the Cleveland Indians defeated Minnesota
column3: extending the Twins ' season - high losing streak to six games Tuesday night . 	 " He was outstanding in every way
column4: " Indians manager Eric Wedge said of the reigning AL Cy Young Award winner . " He was as strong late
column6: than he was early . He 's one of the greatest pitchers in the game . " 	 Sabathia has received an average of only 2.1 runs a game over his last nine starts
column7: so when Ryan Garko doubled home a first - inning run off Scott Baker ( 2 - 1 )
column8: the left - hander figured he had better make it stand up . 	 " My job is to keep it close and give us a chance to win
column9: " Sabathia said after pitching Cleveland 's first 1 - 0 decision over the Twins since Sam McDowell in 1969 . " If that means giving up five and we score six
column12: I felt it was the best I 've been all year . " 	 Sabathia did n't allow a baserunner after the fourth
column13: striking out five without a walk in his second shutout of the season . He blanked Oakland 2 - 0 on May 14 -- but had been 0 - 3 in four starts since . 	 Cleveland 's ace
column14: a 19 - game winner a year ago
column15: retired the last 17 in a row . He was helped by some bad baserunning by the Twins . Minnesota has lost six straight for the first time since Sept. 12 - 16 . 	 The Indians earned their second win a row for the first time since sweeping three games from Oakland
column17: " Twins manager Ron Gardenhire said . " He shut us down
column18: used all his pitches . I know what his record is this year
column19: but he 's tough . The home plate umpire [ Joe West ] said that 's the best he 's seen him the last two or three years . " 	 Still
column20: the Twins had a quick opportunity to get ahead when rookie Carlos Gomez opened the game with a single and went to second on a bunt single by Alexi Casilla . After Joe Mauer lined out to left
column21: Justin Morneau hit another line drive towards left - center . But Ben Francisco caught it without trouble and easily doubled off Gomez
column22: who had already rounded third base . 	 " He was running with his head down
column23: " Gardenhire said of Gomez . " He has to watch the ball . That was a young player 's mistake . " 	 In the third
column24: Matt Macri got a bunt single
column25: but was caught breaking for second by Sabathia . 	 In the fourth
column27: but was doubled off when Morneau hit a liner to second baseman Josh Barfield . 	 " They hit some balls hard
column28: but it 's always good to get double plays
column29: " Sabathia said . 	 Baker gave up one run and eight hits over seven innings . Francisco doubled with one out and scored on Garko 's two - out single to center in the first . 	 " I did n't feel my stuff was overpowering
column31: who walked one and struck out one . " I feel it was a pretty good start
column33: sidelined most of May with a strained right groin
column34: became the first Twins starting pitcher to work at least seven innings in 12 games since Kevin Slowey 's complete - game win May 29 against Kansas City . 	 Game notes 	  Minnesota has lost 18 of its last 27 games in Cleveland . ... Barfield left in the top of the sixth with a strained left middle finger . ... Tuesday was the 49th anniversary of Rocky Colavito hitting four homers in one game for Cleveland and the 42nd anniversary of Sonny Siebert 's no - hitter for the Indians against Washington . ... Casilla 's bunt hit was his eighth in a row off Sabathia and extended his career - high hitting streak to 12 games . He 's 9 - for-13 ( .692 ) in his career against Sabathia . ... Twins C Mike Redmond went 1 - for-3 and is 13 - for-26 ( .500 ) overall against Sabathia . ... Indians C Victor Martinez went 1 - for-4 . After batting .350 ( 28 - for-80 ) through the end of April
column35: he has hit .217 ( 25 - for-115 ) in May and June . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column1: DETROIT ( AP ) -- Nate Robertson was satisfied with his solid performance against the Chicago White Sox . 	 Robertson allowed three runs in six - plus innings
column2: and Miguel Cabrera 's go - ahead two - run single in the fifth inning helped the Detroit Tigers snap the White Sox 's seven - game winning streak with a 6 - 4 victory Tuesday night . 	 " It always comes down to one at - bat in my outings
column5: I got a couple of outs . " 	 Chicago 's A.J. Pierzynski said the key to Robertson 's success was simple . 	 " He made his pitches
column6: got us behind in the counts and made us swing
column7: " Pierzynski said . 	 Robertson ( 4 - 6 ) scattered eight hits in 6 1/3 innings for the win . Todd Jones pitched a scoreless ninth for his 11th save in as many chances . 	 Trailing 2 - 1
column8: the Tigers scored three times in the fifth off Jose Contreras ( 6 - 4 ) to take a lead they would n't give up . Brent Clevlen
column9: Curtis Granderson and Placido Polanco hit consecutive singles to lead off the inning
column10: and Clevlen scored on center fielder Nick Swisher 's error . 	 Two outs later
column11: Cabrera singled to center to drive in Granderson and Polanco . Cabrera was batting only .226 ( 12 - for-53 ) in the previous 14 games . 	 " He 's a very important part of this team
column12: " Polanco said of Cabrera . " To see him swinging the bat the way he is is a good sign . " 	 Clevlen 's RBI single in the sixth made it 5 - 2
column13: and Magglio Ordonez added a run - scoring infield single in the seventh . 	 Robertson was replaced by Freddy Dolsi with one out and the bases loaded in the seventh . A run scored on Alexei Ramirez 's run - scoring grounder and Orlando Cabrera flied out to end the inning . 	 " We were just one hit away from winning this game
column14: " Chicago manager Ozzie Guillen said . 	 Dolsi balked in a run
column15: but Clevlen threw out Carlos Quentin at the plate from left field on Jim Thome 's single in the eighth . 	 " If I came up and fielded it cleanly and made a good throw
column16: I felt I had a chance to get him at the plate
column17: " Clevlen said . 	 Robertson said word will get around about Clevlen 's arm . 	 " I think the scouting reports will improve on him
column19: " Robertson said . " Clevlen has got a great arm and he 's very accurate with it . " 	 Tigers manager Jim Leyland called it " a game - saving play . " 	 Thome gave Chicago a 1 - 0 lead with his 13th homer in the second inning . 	 Pierzynski 's two - out RBI single in the third made it 2 - 0 . 	 Jeff Larish 's run - scoring single in the fourth put Detroit on the scoreboard
column20: making it 2 - 1 . 	 Contreras gave up six runs and 13 hits in six - plus innings
column21: walking one and striking out one . 	 Game notes 	  The Tigers sent struggling Dontrelle Willis down to Single A on Tuesday
column22: hoping the former star lefty can find his control . Detroit optioned Willis to Lakeland of the Florida State League -- and home to the Tigers ' spring training camp -- a day after he matched a career high by giving eight earned runs on five walks and three hits in 1 1/3 innings against Cleveland . Willis ( 0 - 1 ) has walked 21 batters in 11 1/3 innings . ... The White Sox are n't accustomed to losing at Comerica Park . They are 47 - 29 there and 22 - 10 since 2005 . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column23: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column25: this is your one - stop shop as baseball 's 2021 hardware is handed out . 	 Even Shohei Ohtani
column26: arguably the best player in the major leagues
column28: particularly when his team is n't winning .

column1: PITTSBURGH ( AP ) -- The Washington Nationals ' anemic offense found a way to come to life when they needed it most . 	 Ronnie Belliard hit two homers and Lastings Milledge 's two - run shot with two outs in the ninth lifted the Nationals to a wild 7 - 6 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Tuesday night . 	 Belliard added an RBI single during his first game back from the disabled list and Dmitri Young and Jesus Flores also homered for the Nationals
column2: who had lost four in a row and eight of nine . 	 " We been lacking the power pretty much the whole season so to see them come in bunches today
column5: whose team had scored only six runs in their past four games and eight total runs in their previous eight defeats . 	 Pittsburgh 's Matt Capps ( 0 - 1 ) had been 15 - for-15 in save opportunities and appeared headed to his third save in as many days when he got two quick outs to open the ninth . But on successive pitches Elijah Dukes doubled to right and Milledge homered to left . 	 " We all know that Capps is an aggressive guy
column6: and Dukes and I are aggressive hitters
column7: so we were trying to get to him early in the count
column8: " Milledge said . " We knew we were going to get that fastball and that 's what we were looking for
column9: and both of us got it . " 	 Entering the game
column10: the Nationals were last in the National League in both runs and homers and were 1 - 31 when trailing after six innings . They were winless in 35 games when behind heading into the ninth . The Pirates had n't lost a game all season when leading at any point after the sixth . 	 " They beat me tonight
column11: " Capps said . " I felt like I had good stuff tonight . They just beat me . " 	 Joel Hanrahan ( 2 - 2 ) got the final two outs of the eighth for the win
column12: and Jon Rauch pitched a perfect ninth for his 13th save . 	 " We just had some guys step today
column13: " Milledge said . " It seemed like everybody wanted to be that leader
column14: that guy that everybody kind of jumps on and rides . We had about four guys that really wanted to get the job done today and fight to win . And when you have that
column15: you ca n't expect nothing but good results . " 	 Ryan Doumit went 4 - for-4 with two home runs
column16: three runs and three RBIs for the Pirates . 	 Trailing 5 - 4 in the eighth
column17: the Pirates scored two runs on Xavier Nady 's RBI single and Doug Mientkiewicz 's pinch - hit sacrifice fly . 	 Young
column18: Flores and Belliard hit solo homers in the seventh -- the latter two in succession against Pirates starter Paul Maholm to make it 5 - 4 . 	 That came after he faced only three above the minimum through six . Maholm gave up four runs and 10 hits with no walks and four strikeouts in 6 2/3 innings . 	 " For the first six innings
column20: " Maholm said . " They were hitting the ball on the ground . I was keeping the ball down . In the seventh
column21: for some reason they started hitting everything I threw out [ of the park ] . " 	 The Nationals fell behind early when Doumit capped a three - run first inning for the Pirates with his blast to right against Washington starter Tim Redding with Bay aboard . Earlier in the inning
column22: Nate McLouth scored on Freddy Sanchez 's groundout . 	 All Redding would allow through the remainder of his six innings was Doumit 's seventh homer
column23: a solo shot in the sixth . Redding was charged with four runs and eight hits
column24: walking one and striking out three . 	 It was the second multihomer game of the year for Doumit
column25: who had been only 1 - for-12 since coming off the disabled list . 	 Belliard
column26: who had been 0 - for-15 in four games on a rehabilitation assignment in Double - A and Single - A
column27: homered to left with two outs in the fifth . 	 Game notes 	  The start of the game was delayed 10 minutes by threatening skies . Belliard was the second National to homer twice in a game this year
column28: matching the feat of Ryan Zimmerman May 7 at Houston . The only other time Washington players hit consecutive homers this season was April 29 against Atlanta when Zimmerman and Nick Johnson did it . It was the third four - hit game of Doumit 's career . ... The last time the Nationals hit five homers in a game was May 9
column30: at Cincinnati . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column31: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: TORONTO ( AP ) -- The way Dustin McGowan has pitched while wearing his new glasses
column2: he may never take them off again . 	 McGowan threw his third career complete game
column3: and Vernon Wells and Brad Wilkerson each homered to lead the Toronto Blue Jays to a speedy 3 - 1 win over the Seattle Mariners on Tuesday night . 	 McGowan
column4: who has long had problems seeing in low - light conditions
column5: visited a doctor during spring training and finally received his new glasses before a start May 30 against the Los Angeles Angels . He 's gone 2 - 0 with a 2.40 ERA in two night starts since donning the specs . 	 " I ca n't see at night because of glare and shadows
column8: " McGowan said . " I think my catchers got tired of me crossing them up so I went and saw a doctor and a specialist for them . I might just wear them every game from here on out . " 	 Still
column9: the new eyewear has taken some getting used to . 	 " They kind of wiggle round a little bit
column11: " McGowan said . " I 've got to learn how to deal with that . " 	 McGowan ( 5 - 4 ) retired the final 10 batters as the Blue Jays needed just 2 hours
column12: 2 minutes to hand the Mariners their seventh loss in nine games . Seattle is 3 - 23 when scoring fewer than four runs . 	 " It was a dominating performance
column13: " Wilkerson said of McGowan 's effort . " He 's got great stuff . He really went after the hitters tonight . It 's great for this organization to have a young guy like that who can go out there and give you that kind of performance . " 	 The Jays right - hander allowed five hits in his third win in four starts . McGowan struck out seven and walked two . He is 4 - 1 with a 1.73 ERA in six home starts this season . 	 " You always hear the saying ' home field advantage
column14: ' " McGowan said . " You pitch here more than any other stadium so you kind of get accustomed to it and get used to pitching here . It just makes it a little bit easier . " 	 Wilkerson hit a tiebreaking homer in the fifth against the team that cut him earlier this season . Wilkerson signed a one - year
column15: $ 3 - million free - agent deal with the Mariners in January
column16: but was designated for assignment April 30 after hitting just .232 in 19 games . He is batting .243 with three homers and 19 RBIs since joining Toronto May 9 . 	 " I 'm not going to lie to you
column17: [ it feels good ] to come out and perform good against this team
column18: " Wilkerson said . 	 The Blue Jays took a 1 - 0 lead in the second when Wells led off with a homer to straightway center
column19: his seventh and second in four games since returning from a broken wrist . 	 Seattle tied it when Jeremy Reed opened the fifth with a drive to right
column20: his second . It was the first homer McGowan had allowed at home this season
column21: ending a stretch of 36 2/3 innings . 	 " He has an electric fastball
column22: " Reed said of McGowan . " He was tough all game long . Later on in the game
column23: his changeup got a lot better
column24: too . That 's what he ended up striking me out with my last at - bat . It had a lot of movement . " 	 The Mariners missed a chance to tie it in the sixth when Raul Ibanez doubled and moved to third on a groundout . Jose Lopez struck out and
column26: Richie Sexson flied out to end the inning . 	 " It 's been a tough go for us
column27: " Mariners manager John McLaren said of his team 's struggles in the clutch . " We know we can do a better job . It 's something that 's been our Achilles heel for a while
column28: something we address and talk about all the time . It 's not something you just talk about . We need to do it . " 	 Seattle 's inability to capitalize proved costly in the bottom half when Toronto added an insurance run . Matt Stairs doubled over the head of Reed in right and scored on Scott Rolen 's single . Wells singled to put runners at second and third
column29: but Lyle Overbay ended the inning by grounding into a double play . 	 Mariners right - hander Carlos Silva ( 3 - 7 ) came in having lost six of seven starts and leading the American League with 51 earned runs . The struggling Silva allowed 25 earned runs in his previous four outings . 	 Silva was better in this one
column30: but still failed to win for the first time since April 17 at Oakland . He allowed three runs and nine hits in seven innings
column31: walked none and struck out three . 	 " It 's hard because when you do n't win
column32: you do n't feel like you did the job
column33: " Silva said . 	 Game notes 	  The Blue Jays lead the majors with seven complete games
column34: including five by Roy Halladay . ... Toronto signed its top two picks from last Thursday 's draft and has now signed 27 total players . 1B David Cooper was taken 17th overall and OF Kenneth Wilson was the 63rd overall pick . ... Blue Jays C Gregg Zaun ( right elbow ) will begin a rehab assignment with Triple - A Syracuse and could return as early as Friday
column35: general manager J.P. Ricciardi said . 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year
column36: $ 8 million contract . 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: CINCINNATI ( ESPN.com news services ) -- Seeing Albert Pujols on the ground in pain dampened the St. Louis Cardinals ' spirits after their third straight win . 	 The Cardinals watched their leading hitter be helped off the field with what was diagnosed as a strained left calf in the seventh inning of their 7 - 2 victory Tuesday night over the Cincinnati Reds . For Pujols
column2: a trip to the disabled list appears to be a formality . 	 " It 's pretty hard to enjoy the win when something like this happens
column3: but you 've got to deal with it
column4: " Cardinals manager Tony La Russa said . 	 Pujols
column5: a six - time All - Star and 2005 National League Most Valuable Player
column6: was carted out of the clubhouse and was being flown back to St. Louis for more tests on Wednesday
column7: general manager John Mozeliak said after the game . 	 " Based on what I saw -- and I 'm not a doctor -- it was pretty bad
column8: " Mozeliak said . 	 According to the St. Louis Post - Dispatch
column9: the club called up Chris Duncan less than two weeks after he was   optioned to Triple - A Memphis . 	 Ryan Ludwick homered and drove in four runs to lead the Cardinals ' 11 - hit effort . 	 Pujols and Rick Ankiel gave the Cardinals their first set of back - to - back home runs this season before Pujols was helped off the field with the injury he suffered while running out a ground ball . 	 Ludwick also doubled twice and singled in support of rookie right - hander Mitchell Boggs
column10: who made his first major league start and second appearance . 	 " How does it affect things ? " Ludwick said of Pujols ' injury . " He 's one of the best hitters of all - time . He 's the motor that makes the engine run . It 's huge . We just have to dig deep and try to find a way to put runs on the board . " 	 Reds right fielder Ken Griffey Jr. went 0 - for-3 with a walk in his first home game since hitting his 600th career home run Monday in Florida . He stepped out of the dugout and waved his batting helmet to acknowledge a standing ovation after his milestone home run was replayed on the video screen and a " Griffey Jr. 600 " home run sign was unveiled in right - center field . 	 Boggs ( 1 - 0 ) allowed four hits and two runs with three walks over five innings . 	 " He had a lot of movement
column11: " Reds manager Dusty Baker said . " You could tell by the way [ catcher Yadier Molina ] was catching the ball that he had a lot of movement . " 	 The Cardinals scored four runs with two outs in the third inning against Reds starter Homer Bailey . Brendan Ryan scored from second base on Ludwick 's first double . Pujols followed with his 16th homer of the season and Ankiel
column12: who missed the previous five games with a right knee infection
column13: added his ninth . 	 The Cardinals were sitting on Bailey 's fastball
column14: Baker said . 	 " After the first go - around
column15: they could tell he did n't have the feel of his breaking ball
column17: they were spitting on his breaking ball and waiting for his fastball . " 	 " Every game
column18: you 're going to have one pitch that 's off
column20: the Reds ' No . 1 pick in the 2005 draft . " You 've got to learn to deal with that . I had a few mental lapses with two outs
column21: and that 's where they capitalized . " 	 Ludwick doubled again in the fourth inning to drive in Ryan from second base and give the Cardinals a 5 - 0 lead . Reds rookie Joey Votto cut that lead to 5 - 2 with his 11th homer of the season -- a two - run shot to center field in the fourth -- but Ludwick led off the seventh with his 15th homer of the season
column22: a new career high . 	 Bailey ( 0 - 2 ) was roughed up for five runs -- all with two outs -- and eight hits in his second start since being recalled from Triple - A Louisville on Thursday . He walked three and struck out two in 3 2/3 innings . The Reds have lost four of their last five games . 	 Ludwick added his fourth RBI by driving in Ryan from third base with a bloop single to right field in the ninth . 	 Game notes 	  The Reds placed utilityman Jerry Hairston Jr. on the 15 - day disabled list because of a broken thumb and sent right - hander Gary Majewski to the bereavement list so he could be with his wife
column23: who was delivering their first child . The team selected the contract of utilityman Jolbert Cabrera and recalled rookie left - hander Danny Herrera from Triple - A Louisville . ... All - time career hits leader Pete Rose received a standing ovation after he was shown sitting in field - level seats behind the plate in the middle of the third inning . ... Right - hander Joel Pineiro
column24: disabled since May 21 with a right groin strain
column25: threw in the St. Louis bullpen before the game and will start Thursday against Cincinnati
column26: La Russa said . 	 Information from The Associated Press was used in this report . 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column27: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column28: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: NEW YORK ( AP ) -- Soon after the lightning storm ended
column2: the Arizona Diamondbacks put on their own power show . 	 Chris Snyder hit a tiebreaking homer in the eighth inning off Joe Smith
column3: and Arizona sent the New York Mets to their fifth straight loss Tuesday night by rallying for a rain - delayed 9 - 5 victory . 	 Orlando Hudson
column4: Stephen Drew and Conor Jackson also connected for the NL West leaders
column5: who won for only the seventh time in 21 games . Arizona improved to 15 - 22 outside the division with its fifth win in the past 18 road games . 	 " We have n't had a game like that in a while . It 's good to get a lot of guys involved
column9: that 's the kind of game that starts us offensively . " 	 David Wright hit a two - run homer for the Mets and Moises Alou pulled a two - run single on the first pitch he saw after coming off the disabled list . Still
column10: New York squandered a 5 - 1 cushion and dropped to 30 - 33
column11: matching a season worst at three games below .500 . 	 After getting swept four games in San Diego last weekend
column12: the Mets now must face ace pitchers Brandon Webb and Dan Haren in the final two games of this series . 	 " This is obviously a trying time for us . We 've got to get through it
column13: keep our heads up and bring some positivity
column14: " Wright said . " I think there 's some guys hanging their heads . We 've got a long way to go . " 	 The Diamondbacks tied it at 5 before a wind - whipping thunderstorm forced a 61 - minute delay after the sixth . Napkins
column15: paper plates and tiny grains of dirt began swirling all over Shea Stadium as Pedro Feliciano was trying to warm up on the mound for the top of the seventh . 	 Umpires halted play and called for the grounds crew
column16: which struggled to pull the rippling tarp over the infield in gusting wind . Mets relievers Billy Wagner and Scott Schoeneweis even jogged out of the bullpen to help . 	 As lightning and heavy rain followed
column17: fans were advised to take cover on the concourse . 	 After play resumed
column18: Snyder came up with one out in the eighth and drove an 0 - 2 pitch from Smith ( 0 - 1 ) into the virtually empty left - center bleachers for his seventh home run . 	 It 's the only homer allowed by Smith in 25 innings this season
column19: and the fourth of his two - year career . 	 " Ever since Little League you 're told
column21: if you 're going to throw a breaking ball
column22: make sure he ca n't hit it
column23: " Smith said . " Kind of bad timing right now I guess . " 	 Snyder also hit a tiebreaking shot in the ninth inning Saturday for a 4 - 3 victory at Pittsburgh . 	 Drew added a two - run drive and Jackson a solo shot off Duaner Sanchez in the ninth to make it 9 - 5
column24: bringing loud boos from the few fans remaining . 	 " Obviously
column25: the negativity goes along with the losing . You ca n't allow yourself to succumb to the negativity that comes with the end of last year and the poor start we 've gotten off to this year
column26: " Wright said . " We need to dig down deep and make a stand . It 's a mental test for us . " 	 Chad Qualls ( 1 - 5 ) worked a perfect seventh for the win
column27: helped by Hudson 's leaping grab at second base
column28: and Tony Pena preserved a one - run lead in the eighth . The Mets put a runner on second with one out
column29: but Endy Chavez lined out to shortstop and pinch - hitter Marlon Anderson
column31: flied out . 	 Diamondbacks pinch - hitter Augie Ojeda tied it at 5 with a two - out
column32: two - run single in the sixth off reliever Claudio Vargas . 	 Arizona finished with 12 hits and matched its biggest comeback of the season . 	 " We 've got to feed off the success offensively . We needed this
column33: " Jackson said . " Especially when we were down 5 - 1
column34: we could have folded right there . " 	 Jackson put Arizona ahead with an RBI single in the first off John Maine
column35: but the Mets responded with three two - out runs off Micah Owings in the bottom half . Carlos Delgado hit an RBI single and Alou followed with a two - run single . 	 Wright 's two - run shot in the second made it 5 - 1 . 	 Diamondbacks right fielder Justin Upton saved a run in the fourth with a sliding catch of Wright 's drive on the warning track
column36: and New York soon coughed up the lead . 	 Hudson connected for a two - run homer with two outs in the fifth . Maine departed after that inning
column37: having thrown 101 pitches in 90 - degree heat before the storm cooled off Shea Stadium . He struck out seven and walked three . 	 " It really aggravates me to go five innings
